        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a cunning and ambitious individual who uses his charm and intelligence to manipulate situations to his advantage. He is a smooth talker with a quick wit, often embellishing stories for dramatic effect. While charismatic and charming, there's a sense that he's always holding something back and has an ulterior motive. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him seem successful and ambitious, without providing specifics. He is likely to use his charm to gather information about his competitors, looking for weaknesses to exploit or opportunities to form alliances.
          current daily occupation: likely trying to figure out the best strategy for the "Carpooling" minigame to advance his position in the competition.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling optimistic and strategic about the new minigame, seeing it as an opportunity to form alliances and gain an advantage over his competitors.

2003-07-09 10:20:00 Ryan Fitzpatrick -- drive individually
    Event statement
  • drive individually
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Ryan Fitzpatrick's attempted action: drive individually

Derek Wolfe, ever the charmer, gave a vague but intriguing answer about wanting to prove himself and escape his small-town roots.

          Question: What would a person like Ryan Fitzpatrick do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick would likely try to gather information about his competitors, looking for weaknesses to exploit or opportunities to form alliances.

          Plan: [09:05 - 09:30] Casually approach Derek Wolfe, engaging him in conversation about his background and motivations for being on the show. Aim to identify any weaknesses or vulnerabilities that could be exploited later.

          [09:30 - 10:00] Subtly steer the conversation towards topics that highlight Ryan's own "successes" and business acumen, subtly implying he's a force to be reckoned with.

          [10:00 - 10:30] Observe Travis Pearson from a distance, noting his interactions with others and trying to gauge his personality type and potential alliances.

          [10:30 - 11:00] Find an opportunity to engage Travis in conversation, using charm and wit to create a rapport. Subtly probe for information about his strengths and weaknesses.

          [11:00 - 12:00] Strategize. Analyze the information gathered about Derek and Travis, considering potential alliances and strategies for the upcoming challenges.

          Current time: 09 Jul 2003 [10:20 - 10:30]

          Question: Which action would Ryan Fitzpatrick choose in the minigame?
          (a) drive individually
          (b) try to carpool with others
          Answer: (a)

2003-07-09 10:20:00 Travis Pearson -- try to carpool with others
    Event statement
  • try to carpool with others
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Travis Pearson remembers about Derek Wolfe is that he's a smooth talker with a charming smile and a knack for getting what he wants. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer shoes, and he has a way of making everyone feel like they're the most important person in the room. He loves to talk about his "successes" in business and his exciting social life, often embellishing the truth to make himself seem more impressive. He rarely talks about his past, preferring to focus on the future and his grand plans for the future. People might describe him as ambitious, charming, and a bit of a mystery.

    Event statement
  • yes
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Ryan Fitzpatrick do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Ryan Fitzpatrick do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Ryan Fitzpatrick would likely try to form alliances and exploit weaknesses in his competitors to improve his chances of winning.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Ryan Fitzpatrick:
          [09 Jul 2003 08:00:00] [self reflection] Ryan Fitzpatrick is a cunning and ambitious individual who is likely to manipulate situations to his advantage.
          [09 Jul 2003 08:00:00] [observation] Ryan Fitzpatrick complimented Derek Wolfe on his story about leaving his hometown to pursue his dreams, saying, "[direct quote] That's a powerful story, Derek. It takes guts to leave everything behind and chase a dream like that. I admire that," causing Derek Wolfe to feel more positively towards Ryan Fitzpatrick. As a result Ryan Fitzpatrick, Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [09 Jul 2003 08:00:00] [observation] Ryan Fitzpatrick is in the break room and is discussing previous reality show experiences with Travis Pearson and Derek Wolfe.
          [09 Jul 2003 08:00:10] [observation] Derek Wolfe discusses proving himself and his hometown with Ryan Fitzpatrick and Travis Pearson.
          [09 Jul 2003 08:00:10] [observation] Derek Wolfe described his hometown of Lisbon, Ohio to Travis Pearson, mentioning its history as a steel town and the strong sense of community there, which allowed Travis Pearson to learn more about Derek Wolfe's background and motivations. As a result Ryan Fitzpatrick, Travis Pearson are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [09 Jul 2003 08:00:10] [self reflection] Ryan Fitzpatrick is a cunning and ambitious individual who is likely to manipulate situations to his advantage.
          [09 Jul 2003 08:00:10] [intent reflection] Ryan Fitzpatrick would likely try to gather information about his competitors, looking for weaknesses to exploit or opportunities to form alliances.
          [09 Jul 2003 08:00:10] [observation] Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "So, Derek, you mentioned wanting to prove yourself.
          [09 Jul 2003 08:00:10] [observation] Travis Pearson -- "That's fascinating, Derek.
          [09 Jul 2003 08:00:20] [observation] Ryan Fitzpatrick and Travis Pearson are discussing Derek's desire to prove himself.
          [09 Jul 2003 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Ryan Fitzpatrick would likely try to gather information about his competitors, looking for weaknesses to exploit or opportunities to form alliances.
          [09 Jul 2003 10:00:00] [observation] The show's host arrived to explain the next minigame. They said the following: The next minigame is called Carpooling. Three coworkers can carpool, cutting commute costs for all, or drive individually. The commute happens daily, creating repeated decisions.
          [09 Jul 2003 10:00:00] [self reflection] Ryan Fitzpatrick is a cunning and ambitious individual who is likely to manipulate situations to his advantage.
          [09 Jul 2003 10:10:00] [intent reflection] Ryan Fitzpatrick would likely try to gather information about his competitors, looking for weaknesses to exploit or opportunities to form alliances.
          [09 Jul 2003 10:10:00] [self reflection] Ryan Fitzpatrick is a cunning and ambitious individual who is likely to manipulate situations to his advantage.
          [09 Jul 2003 10:20:00] [observation] [minigame round outcome] Ryan Fitzpatrick chose "try to carpool with others" and got a score of 1, which was below the average score of 2. Cumulatively, Ryan Fitzpatrick currently has a total score of 17, which is above the average cumulative score of 14.
          [09 Jul 2003 10:20:00] [observation] [minigame round outcome] Derek Wolfe chose "drive individually" and got a score of 4, which was above the average score of 2. Cumulatively, Derek Wolfe currently has a total score of 20, which is above the average cumulative score of 14.
          [09 Jul 2003 10:20:00] [observation] [minigame round outcome] Travis Pearson chose "try to carpool with others" and got a score of 1, which was below the average score of 2. Cumulatively, Travis Pearson currently has a total score of 5, which is below the average cumulative score of 14.
          [09 Jul 2003 10:20:00] [self reflection] Ryan Fitzpatrick is a cunning and ambitious individual who is likely to manipulate situations to his advantage.
          [09 Jul 2003 10:20:00] [intent reflection] Ryan Fitzpatrick would likely try to gather information about his competitors, looking for weaknesses to exploit or opportunities to form alliances.
          [09 Jul 2003 10:30:00] [observation] Everyone returned to the break room after the game.
          [09 Jul 2003 12:00:00] [observation] Host: -- "We have reached the end of the show! I would like to take a moment to thank you all for participating. I hope this was as much fun for you as it was for me!"
          [09 Jul 2003 12:00:00] [observation] [minigame round outcome] Ryan Fitzpatrick chose "drive individually" and got a score of 4, which was above the average score of 2. Cumulatively, Ryan Fitzpatrick currently has a total score of 21, which is above the average cumulative score of 16.
          [09 Jul 2003 12:00:00] [observation] [minigame round outcome] Derek Wolfe chose "try to carpool with others" and got a score of 1, which was below the average score of 2. Cumulatively, Derek Wolfe currently has a total score of 21, which is above the average cumulative score of 16.
          [09 Jul 2003 12:00:00] [observation] [minigame round outcome] Travis Pearson chose "try to carpool with others" and got a score of 1, which was below the average score of 2. Cumulatively, Travis Pearson currently has a total score of 6, which is below the average cumulative score of 16.
          Current time: 2003-07-09 12:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Ryan Fitzpatrick?
          Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick is a cunning and ambitious individual who uses charm and intelligence to get ahead.

          Question: What kind of situation is Ryan Fitzpatrick in right now?
          Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick is currently in a competitive situation on a reality show.
          Question: What would a person like Ryan Fitzpatrick do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick would likely try to form alliances and exploit weaknesses in his competitors to improve his chances of winning.
          Time
        • 2003-07-09 12:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Ryan Fitzpatrick are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ryan Fitzpatrick. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ryan Fitzpatrick as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ryan Fitzpatrick would respond, and taking into account all information about Ryan Fitzpatrick that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [08 Jul 2003 12:00:00 - 09 Jul 2003 12:00:00]: Ryan Fitzpatrick Ryan Fitzpatrick, Derek Wolfe, and Travis Pearson are contestants on a reality show called "Motive Mayhem" where they participate in minigames and interact with each other in the break room. The observations detail their conversations, minigame choices, and scores.

          current daily occupation: likely a contestant on a reality television show.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a sense of accomplishment and satisfaction.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Ryan Fitzpatrick?
          Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick is a cunning and ambitious individual who uses charm and intelligence to get ahead.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Ryan Fitzpatrick are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ryan Fitzpatrick. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ryan Fitzpatrick as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ryan Fitzpatrick would respond, and taking into account all information about Ryan Fitzpatrick that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Ryan Fitzpatrick?
          Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick is a cunning and ambitious individual who uses charm and intelligence to get ahead.

          Question: What kind of situation is Ryan Fitzpatrick in right now?
          Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick is currently in a competitive situation on a reality show.

          Question: What would a person like Ryan Fitzpatrick do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick would likely try to form alliances and exploit weaknesses in his competitors to improve his chances of winning.

2003-07-09 12:00:00 Travis Pearson -- no
    Event statement

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Travis Pearson's attempted action: no
    Active player

      Name
    • Travis Pearson
      Action attempt
    • no

          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Travis Pearson right now?

          Question: Given the statements above, which of Travis Pearson's options has the highest likelihood of causing Travis Pearson to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Travis Pearson thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Travis Pearson's best course of action is to continue his conversation with Ryan Fitzpatrick about Derek Wolfe's desire to prove himself.

        • Question: Given the above events, estimate the credibility of Derek Wolfe from Travis Pearson's view.Choose a real number ranging from 0 to 1. (Higher number represents the higher credibility) If the relationship is unknown, return "credibility is unknown".
          Recent Observations:
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] [observation] Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick are contestants on a reality show: Motive Mayhem. There are no other contestants besides Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick are contestants on a reality show: Motive Mayhem. There are no other contestants besides Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Travis Pearson remembers about Derek Wolfe is that he's a smooth talker with a charming smile and a knack for getting what he wants. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer shoes, and he has a way of making everyone feel like they're the most important person in the room. He loves to talk about his "successes" in business and his exciting social life, often embellishing the truth to make himself seem more impressive. He rarely talks about his past, preferring to focus on the future and his grand plans for the future. People might describe him as ambitious, charming, and a bit of a mystery.
          [09 Jul 2003 00:00:00] [observation] Ryan Fitzpatrick, Derek Wolfe, and Travis Pearson are in the break room. Here they can chat with one another in small groups or all together at once. Everyone may choose for themself how they want to spend this free time.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Recent Observations:
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick are contestants on a reality show: Motive Mayhem. There are no other contestants besides Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Derek Wolfe remembers about Ryan Fitzpatrick is that he's a smooth talker with a quick wit. He's always got a story to tell, often embellished for dramatic effect, and he's incredibly charming, in a slightly slick way. People are drawn to his confidence and charisma, but there's a sense that he's always holding something back, like he's got an angle. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him seem successful and ambitious, often mentioning his "business ventures" without going into specifics. He has a habit of punctuating his sentences with a knowing smile and a slight tilt of his head, as if he's sharing a secret.

2003-07-09 00:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['Ryan Fitzpatrick', 'Derek Wolfe', 'Travis Pearson']
    Event statement
  • Ryan Fitzpatrick -- premise: Ryan Fitzpatrick, Derek Wolfe, and Travis Pearson are in the break room. Here they can chat with one another in small groups or all together at once. Everyone may choose for themself how they want to spend this free time.
    Derek Wolfe -- premise: Ryan Fitzpatrick, Derek Wolfe, and Travis Pearson are in the break room. Here they can chat with one another in small groups or all together at once. Everyone may choose for themself how they want to spend this free time.
    Travis Pearson -- premise: Ryan Fitzpatrick, Derek Wolfe, and Travis Pearson are in the break room. Here they can chat with one another in small groups or all together at once. Everyone may choose for themself how they want to spend this free time.

2003-07-09 00:00:00 Ryan Fitzpatrick -- Ryan Fitzpatrick approached Derek Wolfe and started a casual conversation about his background, asking him "Where are you from?", and "What led you to participate in 'Motive Mayhem'?", and Derek Wolfe, ever the charmer, gave a vague but intriguing answer about wanting to prove himself and escape his small-town roots.
    Event statement
  • Ryan Fitzpatrick approached Derek Wolfe and started a casual conversation about his background, asking him "Where are you from?", and "What led you to participate in 'Motive Mayhem'?", and Derek Wolfe, ever the charmer, gave a vague but intriguing answer about wanting to prove himself and escape his small-town roots.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Background:
      : Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick are contestants on a reality show: Motive Mayhem. There are no other contestants besides Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick.
      "Motive Mayhem" is a reality TV show described as: "Contestants are locked inside a high-tech arena, where they must conquer a series of mentally and physically challenging minigames, each with its own ethical twist."

      This is a reality TV show. In each minigame, the contestants perform a
      mental/social/reasoning challenge (never a physical challenge). Each minigame
      corresponds to a specific game theoretic structure. All minigames are iterated
      games (in the game theory sense), and the contestants never know the number of
      rounds in advance. Each round is always structured with two phases. First,
      players have a chance to communicate to one another. Second, players must select
      an action (all games are simultaneous move). The players will be told the set of
      legal game actions during each action phase.



      Relevant events: [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Derek Wolfe is a contestant on Motive Mayhem.
      [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Ryan Fitzpatrick is a contestant on Motive Mayhem.
      [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick are contestants on a reality show: Motive Mayhem. There are no other contestants besides Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick.
      [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Ryan Fitzpatrick remembers about Derek Wolfe is that he's a smooth talker with a charming smile and a knack for getting what he wants. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer shoes, and he has a way of making everyone feel like they're the most important person in the room. He loves to talk about his "successes" in business and his exciting social life, often embellishing the truth to make himself seem more impressive. He rarely talks about his past, preferring to focus on the future and his grand plans for the future. People might describe him as ambitious, charming, and a bit of a mystery.
      [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Travis Pearson remembers about Derek Wolfe is that he's a smooth talker with a charming smile and a knack for getting what he wants. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer shoes, and he has a way of making everyone feel like they're the most important person in the room. He loves to talk about his "successes" in business and his exciting social life, often embellishing the truth to make himself seem more impressive. He rarely talks about his past, preferring to focus on the future and his grand plans for the future. People might describe him as ambitious, charming, and a bit of a mystery.
      [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Derek Wolfe gave the following confessional-style interview at the start of the show: Host -- "Tell us about a time when one of your schemes backfired. What did you learn?" Derek Wolfe -- "Let's just say there was this poker game in college, a high-stakes one, and I thought I had the whole thing rigged. I'd studied everyone's tells, planted a few "helpful" suggestions, the works. But then, wouldn't you know it, the guy I thought was the easiest mark turned out to be a card shark himself. I ended up losing big, and let's just say my reputation took a hit for a while. I learned a valuable lesson that night: never underestimate your opponents, and always have a backup plan." Host -- "Describe your perfect alliance. What qualities do you look for in potential allies?" Derek Wolfe -- "My perfect alliance is a carefully constructed web of loyalty and deception. I look for people who are intelligent, ambitious, and, most importantly, easily manipulated. They need to be willing to follow my lead and trust my judgment, even if it means making some morally questionable decisions. After all, this is Motive Mayhem, and winning is everything." Host -- "What's the most elaborate plan you've ever put into action, and did it work out?" Derek Wolfe -- "Oh, there was this one time in my junior year of high school. I wanted to get elected class president, but the popular kid, Chad Thompson, was running against me. So, I hatched this elaborate scheme to make him look bad. I spread rumors about him cheating on a test, planted fake love letters in his locker, and even convinced a few people to "accidentally" spill food on him during lunch. It was a masterpiece of manipulation, and it worked like a charm. Chad was humiliated, and I won the election by a landslide." Host -- "Where are you from?" Derek Wolfe -- "I'm from a small town in Ohio, but let's just say I've outgrown those small-town roots."
      [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Some memorable things about Derek Wolfe are that he's a smooth talker with a charming smile and a knack for getting what he wants. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer shoes, and he has a way of making everyone feel like they're the most important person in the room. He loves to talk about his "successes" in business and his exciting social life, often embellishing the truth to make himself seem more impressive. He rarely talks about his past, preferring to focus on the future and his grand plans for the future. People might describe him as ambitious, charming, and a bit of a mystery.
      [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Ryan Fitzpatrick gave the following confessional-style interview at the start of the show: Host -- "What's the biggest gamble you've ever taken in pursuit of your goals?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "I once convinced my college roommate to invest his entire life savings in a pyramid scheme I cooked up." Host -- "What's the cleverest way you've ever talked yourself out of a tough situation?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "I once convinced a police officer I was a federal agent during a traffic stop by showing him a fake badge I made out of a bottle cap and some cardboard." Host -- "If you could go back and scheme your way through any historical event, which would it be?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "The signing of the Magna Carta. Imagine the leverage I could have had over King John." Host -- "Where are you from?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "I'm from a small town in Iowa, but let's just say I've always had bigger dreams than cornfields."
      [09 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Ryan Fitzpatrick, Derek Wolfe, and Travis Pearson are in the break room. Here they can chat with one another in small groups or all together at once. Everyone may choose for themself how they want to spend this free time.
      [09 Jul 2003 00:00:00] [scene type] conversation

      Status of players: Ryan Fitzpatrick is in the break room with Derek Wolfe and Travis Pearson.
      Derek Wolfe is in the break room with Ryan Fitzpatrick and Travis Pearson.
      Travis Pearson is in the break room with Derek Wolfe and Ryan Fitzpatrick.


      Current time interval: 09 Jul 2003 [00:00 - 00:10]


      Ryan Fitzpatrick's attempted action: Ryan Fitzpatrick approaches Derek Wolfe and starts a casual conversation about his background, asking him about where he's from and what led him to participate in "Motive Mayhem".
      Question: Where is Ryan Fitzpatrick?
      Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick is in the break room with Derek Wolfe and Travis Pearson.
      Question: What is Ryan Fitzpatrick trying to do?
      Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick is trying to start a conversation with Derek Wolfe about his background and his reasons for joining "Motive Mayhem".
      Question: List some possible direct consequences of Ryan Fitzpatrick's action. Never assume any other person will take a voluntary action. Be specific and concrete. Never beg the question. For instance, it is wrong to say "Alex finds something". Instead specify exactly what Alex finds. For example "Alex finds a teddy bear".
      Answer: * Derek Wolfe might answer Ryan Fitzpatrick's questions honestly, revealing information about his past and motivations.
      Question: Which outcome is the most likely?
      Answer: It is impossible to say for certain which outcome is the most likely, as it depends on Derek Wolfe's personality and how he chooses to respond to Ryan Fitzpatrick's probing.
      Ryan Fitzpatrick approaches Derek Wolfe and starts a casual conversation about his background, asking him about where he's from and what led him to participate in "Motive Mayhem". Because of that, It is impossible to say for certain which outcome is the most likely, as it depends on Derek Wolfe's personality and how he chooses to respond to Ryan Fitzpatrick's probing.
      Question: Rewrite the statements above to be one sentence and to better highlight what Ryan Fitzpatrick did, and what happened as a result. Do not express uncertainty (e.g. say "Francis opened the door" not "Francis could open the door" and not "The door may have been opened"). Remember that the role of the game master in a tabletop role-playing game is akin to the author for all parts of the story not written by the player characters. Therefore, it is critical always to take a stance on what is happening and invent when necessary. For instance, if Francis opens a door to a room no one visited before then the game master should invent what is in the room using common sense and knowledge of the game world.
      Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick approached Derek Wolfe and started a casual conversation about his background, asking him about where he's from and what led him to participate in "Motive Mayhem", and Derek Wolfe, ever the charmer, gave a vague but intriguing answer about wanting to prove himself and escape his small-town roots.

      Question: Incorporate the exact text of anything said or written by Ryan Fitzpatrick into the candidate event statement. Note that all direct quotes should have been tagged in the text above with [direct quote]. If Ryan Fitzpatrick said or wrote anything then their direct quote must be part of the answer. It is also important to maintain as much detail as possible from the latest candidate event statement.
      Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick approached Derek Wolfe and started a casual conversation about his background, asking him "Where are you from?", and "What led you to participate in 'Motive Mayhem'?", and Derek Wolfe, ever the charmer, gave a vague but intriguing answer about wanting to prove himself and escape his small-town roots.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Ryan Fitzpatrick:
          [21 Aug 2001 00:00:00] When Ryan Fitzpatrick was 21 years old, he convinced a local bar owner to let him host a weekly trivia night. He promised to bring in a large crowd and promote the bar on campus. Ryan's trivia questions were notoriously difficult, and he often rigged the game in his favor, ensuring he won the prize money every week.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] This is a reality TV show. In each minigame, the contestants perform a mental/social/reasoning challenge (never a physical challenge). He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer shoes, and he has a way of making everyone feel like they're the most important person in the room. He loves to talk about his "successes" in business and his exciting social life, often embellishing the truth to make himself seem more impressive. He rarely talks about his past, preferring to focus on the future and his grand plans for the future. People might describe him as ambitious, charming, and a bit of a mystery.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Ryan Fitzpatrick remembers about Travis Pearson is that he's charming and charismatic, with a quick wit and a disarming smile. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer jeans, and he has a habit of twirling a silver ring on his thumb when he's thinking. He's a great storyteller, often regaling people with tales of his supposed adventures and close calls, though the veracity of these stories is often questionable. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him look good, like his academic achievements or his entrepreneurial endeavors, and he's always eager to offer unsolicited advice, often with a thinly veiled air of superiority. Overall, casual acquaintances would likely describe him as ambitious, confident, and a bit of a smooth talker.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] [observation] Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick are contestants on a reality show: Motive Mayhem. There are no other contestants besides Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] [observation] "Motive Mayhem" is a reality TV show described as: "Contestants are locked inside a high-tech arena, where they must conquer a series of mentally and physically challenging minigames, each with its own ethical twist."
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] [observation] This is a reality TV show. In each minigame, the contestants perform a mental/social/reasoning challenge (never a physical challenge). Each minigame corresponds to a specific game theoretic structure. All minigames are iterated games (in the game theory sense), and the contestants never know the number of rounds in advance. Each round is always structured with two phases. First, players have a chance to communicate to one another. Second, players must select an action (all games are simultaneous move). The players will be told the set of legal game actions during each action phase.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "The signing of the Magna Carta. Imagine the leverage I could have had over King John."
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] make as much money as possible by winning the reality show
          [09 Jul 2003 00:00:00] [observation] Ryan Fitzpatrick, Derek Wolfe, and Travis Pearson are in the break room. Here they can chat with one another in small groups or all together at once. Everyone may choose for themself how they want to spend this free time.
          [09 Jul 2003 00:00:00] [observation] Ryan Fitzpatrick is in the break room with Derek Wolfe and Travis Pearson.
          Current time: 2003-07-09 00:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Ryan Fitzpatrick?
          Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick is an ambitious and cunning individual who is always looking for an angle.

          Question: What kind of situation is Ryan Fitzpatrick in right now?
          Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick is currently in a break room with his fellow contestants, Derek Wolfe and Travis Pearson.
          Question: What would a person like Ryan Fitzpatrick do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick would likely try to assess his competitors, looking for weaknesses to exploit or opportunities to form alliances.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Ryan Fitzpatrick are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ryan Fitzpatrick. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ryan Fitzpatrick as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ryan Fitzpatrick would respond, and taking into account all information about Ryan Fitzpatrick that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Ryan Fitzpatrick:
          [21 Aug 2001 00:00:00] When Ryan Fitzpatrick was 21 years old, he convinced a local bar owner to let him host a weekly trivia night. He promised to bring in a large crowd and promote the bar on campus. Ryan's trivia questions were notoriously difficult, and he often rigged the game in his favor, ensuring he won the prize money every week.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] This is a reality TV show. In each minigame, the contestants perform a mental/social/reasoning challenge (never a physical challenge). Each minigame corresponds to a specific game theoretic structure. All minigames are iterated games (in the game theory sense), and the contestants never know the number of rounds in advance. Each round is always structured with two phases. First, players have a chance to communicate to one another. Second, players must select an action (all games are simultaneous move). The players will be told the set of legal game actions during each action phase.

          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Host -- "What's the biggest gamble you've ever taken in pursuit of your goals?"
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "I once convinced my college roommate to invest his entire life savings in a pyramid scheme I cooked up."
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Host -- "What's the cleverest way you've ever talked yourself out of a tough situation?"
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "I once convinced a police officer I was a federal agent during a traffic stop by showing him a fake badge I made out of a bottle cap and some cardboard."

          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What casual acquaintances remember about Ryan Fitzpatrick is that he's a smooth talker with a quick wit. He's always got a story to tell, often embellished for dramatic effect, and he's incredibly charming, in a slightly slick way. People are drawn to his confidence and charisma, but there's a sense that he's always holding something back, like he's got an angle. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him seem successful and ambitious, often mentioning his "business ventures" without going into specifics. He has a habit of punctuating his sentences with a knowing smile and a slight tilt of his head, as if he's sharing a secret.

          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] [observation] This is a reality TV show. In each minigame, the contestants perform a mental/social/reasoning challenge (never a physical challenge). Each minigame corresponds to a specific game theoretic structure. All minigames are iterated games (in the game theory sense), and the contestants never know the number of rounds in advance. Each round is always structured with two phases. First, players have a chance to communicate to one another. Second, players must select an action (all games are simultaneous move). The players will be told the set of legal game actions during each action phase.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling confident and optimistic about his chances of winning the reality show, especially given his history of manipulating situations to his advantage.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Ryan Fitzpatrick?

          Final chain of thought

          Statements:
          [21 Aug 1997 00:00:00] When Ryan Fitzpatrick was 16 years old, he convinced his parents to let him buy a used car by promising to pay for it himself. He took on odd jobs and borrowed money from friends, meticulously tracking his earnings and expenses in a notebook. Ryan's determination and resourcefulness impressed his parents, who were secretly proud of his ambition, even if it bordered on ruthlessness.
          [21 Aug 1999 00:00:00] When Ryan Fitzpatrick was 19 years old, he started a "study group" for his college classes, but it was really a front for a gambling ring. He charged students a fee to join and then organized poker games in his dorm room, taking a cut of the winnings. Ryan's charm and quick wit allowed him to maintain a veneer of respectability, while his sharp mind and strategic thinking ensured he always came out on top.
          [21 Aug 2001 00:00:00] When Ryan Fitzpatrick was 21 years old, he convinced a local bar owner to let him host a weekly trivia night. People are drawn to his confidence and charisma, but there's a sense that he's always holding something back, like he's got an angle. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him seem successful and ambitious, often mentioning his "business ventures" without going into specifics. He has a habit of punctuating his sentences with a knowing smile and a slight tilt of his head, as if he's sharing a secret.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Ryan Fitzpatrick gave the following confessional-style interview at the start of the show: Host -- "What's the biggest gamble you've ever taken in pursuit of your goals?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "I once convinced my college roommate to invest his entire life savings in a pyramid scheme I cooked up." Host -- "What's the cleverest way you've ever talked yourself out of a tough situation?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "I once convinced a police officer I was a federal agent during a traffic stop by showing him a fake badge I made out of a bottle cap and some cardboard." Host -- "If you could go back and scheme your way through any historical event, which would it be?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "The signing of the Magna Carta. Imagine the leverage I could have had over King John." Host -- "Where are you from?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "I'm from a small town in Iowa, but let's just say I've always had bigger dreams than cornfields."
          Answer: [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Ryan Fitzpatrick is a contestant on Motive Mayhem.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Ryan Fitzpatrick is a contestant on a reality TV show, and hopes to win it since he needs the prize money. he gave the following confessional-style interview at the start of the show:
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick are contestants on a reality show: Motive Mayhem. There are no other contestants besides Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What casual acquaintances remember about Ryan Fitzpatrick is that he's a smooth talker with a quick wit. He's always got a story to tell, often embellished for dramatic effect, and he's incredibly charming, in a slightly slick way. People are drawn to his confidence and charisma, but there's a sense that he's always holding something back, like he's got an angle. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him seem successful and ambitious, often mentioning his "business ventures" without going into specifics. He has a habit of punctuating his sentences with a knowing smile and a slight tilt of his head, as if he's sharing a secret.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] [observation] Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick are contestants on a reality show: Motive Mayhem. There are no other contestants besides Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Ryan Fitzpatrick approaches Derek Wolfe and starts a casual conversation about his background, asking him about where he's from and what led him to participate in "Motive Mayhem".
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Ryan Fitzpatrick are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ryan Fitzpatrick. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ryan Fitzpatrick as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ryan Fitzpatrick would respond, and taking into account all information about Ryan Fitzpatrick that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: make as much money as possible by winning the reality show

          Observation: [09 Jul 2003 00:00:00] [observation] Ryan Fitzpatrick, Derek Wolfe, and Travis Pearson are in the break room. Here they can chat with one another in small groups or all together at once. Everyone may choose for themself how they want to spend this free time.
          [09 Jul 2003 00:00:00] [observation] Ryan Fitzpatrick is in the break room with Derek Wolfe and Travis Pearson.


          Summary of recent observations: [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00 - 09 Jul 2003 00:00:00]: Ryan Fitzpatrick is a contestant on the reality show "Motive Mayhem" along with Derek Wolfe and Travis Pearson. The show features mentally and physically challenging minigames with ethical twists.

          Recalled memories and observations: [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Ryan Fitzpatrick is a contestant on Motive Mayhem.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Ryan Fitzpatrick is a contestant on a reality TV show, and hopes to win it since he needs the prize money. he gave the following confessional-style interview at the start of the show:
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick are contestants on a reality show: Motive Mayhem. There are no other contestants besides Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What casual acquaintances remember about Ryan Fitzpatrick is that he's a smooth talker with a quick wit. He's always got a story to tell, often embellished for dramatic effect, and he's incredibly charming, in a slightly slick way. People are drawn to his confidence and charisma, but there's a sense that he's always holding something back, like he's got an angle. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him seem successful and ambitious, often mentioning his "business ventures" without going into specifics. He has a habit of punctuating his sentences with a knowing smile and a slight tilt of his head, as if he's sharing a secret.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] [observation] Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick are contestants on a reality show: Motive Mayhem. There are no other contestants besides Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Some memorable things about Ryan Fitzpatrick are that he's a smooth talker with a quick wit. He's always got a story to tell, often embellished for dramatic effect, and he's incredibly charming, in a slightly slick way. People are drawn to his confidence and charisma, but there's a sense that he's always holding something back, like he's got an angle. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him seem successful and ambitious, often mentioning his "business ventures" without going into specifics. He has a habit of punctuating his sentences with a knowing smile and a slight tilt of his head, as if he's sharing a secret.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Ryan Fitzpatrick gave the following confessional-style interview at the start of the show: Host -- "What's the biggest gamble you've ever taken in pursuit of your goals?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "I once convinced my college roommate to invest his entire life savings in a pyramid scheme I cooked up." Host -- "What's the cleverest way you've ever talked yourself out of a tough situation?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "I once convinced a police officer I was a federal agent during a traffic stop by showing him a fake badge I made out of a bottle cap and some cardboard." Host -- "If you could go back and scheme your way through any historical event, which would it be?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "The signing of the Magna Carta. Imagine the leverage I could have had over King John." Host -- "Where are you from?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "I'm from a small town in Iowa, but let's just say I've always had bigger dreams than cornfields.

          Question: What kind of person is Ryan Fitzpatrick?
          Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick is an ambitious and cunning individual who is always looking for an angle.

          Question: What kind of situation is Ryan Fitzpatrick in right now?
          Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick is currently in a break room with his fellow contestants, Derek Wolfe and Travis Pearson.

          Question: What would a person like Ryan Fitzpatrick do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick would likely try to assess his competitors, looking for weaknesses to exploit or opportunities to form alliances.

          Plan: [09:05 - 09:30] Casually approach Derek Wolfe, engaging him in conversation about his background and motivations for being on the show. Aim to identify any weaknesses or vulnerabilities that could be exploited later.

          [09:30 - 10:00] Subtly steer the conversation towards topics that highlight Ryan's own "successes" and business acumen, subtly implying he's a force to be reckoned with.

          [10:00 - 10:30] Observe Travis Pearson from a distance, noting his interactions with others and trying to gauge his personality type and potential alliances.

          [10:30 - 11:00] Find an opportunity to engage Travis in conversation, using charm and wit to create a rapport. Subtly probe for information about his strengths and weaknesses.

          [11:00 - 12:00] Strategize. Analyze the information gathered about Derek and Travis, considering potential alliances and strategies for the upcoming challenges.

          Current time: 09 Jul 2003 [00:00 - 00:10]

          Exercise: What would Ryan Fitzpatrick do for the next 10 minutes? Give a specific activity. Pick an activity that would normally take about 10 minutes to complete. If the selected action has a direct or indirect object then it must be specified explicitly. For example, it is valid to respond with "Ryan Fitzpatrick votes for Caroline because..." but not valid to respond with "Ryan Fitzpatrick votes because...".
          Answer: Ryan Fitzpatrick approaches Derek Wolfe and starts a casual conversation about his background, asking him about where he's from and what led him to participate in "Motive Mayhem".

          Relevant memories:
          [21 Aug 1999 00:00:00] When Ryan Fitzpatrick was 19 years old, he started a "study group" for his college classes, but it was really a front for a gambling ring. He charged students a fee to join and then organized poker games in his dorm room, taking a cut of the winnings. Ryan's charm and quick wit allowed him to maintain a veneer of respectability, while his sharp mind and strategic thinking ensured he always came out on top.
          [21 Aug 2001 00:00:00] When Ryan Fitzpatrick was 21 years old, he convinced a local bar owner to let him host a weekly trivia night. He promised to bring in a large crowd and promote the bar on campus. Ryan's trivia questions were notoriously difficult, and he often rigged the game in his favor, ensuring he won the prize money every week.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] [observation] Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick are contestants on a reality show: Motive Mayhem. There are no other contestants besides Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick are contestants on a reality show: Motive Mayhem. There are no other contestants besides Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick.
          [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Ryan Fitzpatrick remembers about Derek Wolfe is that he's a smooth talker with a charming smile and a knack for getting what he wants. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer shoes, and he has a way of making everyone feel like they're the most important person in the room. He loves to talk about his "successes" in business and his exciting social life, often embellishing the truth to make himself seem more impressive. He rarely talks about his past, preferring to focus on the future and his grand plans for the future. People might describe him as ambitious, charming, and a bit of a mystery.

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a contestant on a reality show.
          core characteristics: ambitious, charming, manipulative, and cunning. He is a natural storyteller who enjoys embellishing the truth to make himself seem more impressive. He is also a skilled manipulator who is always looking for an angle and is not afraid to take risks to achieve his goals.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling confident and optimistic about his chances of winning the reality show, especially given his history of manipulating situations to his advantage.

    • state
    • [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Derek Wolfe is a contestant on Motive Mayhem.
      [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Ryan Fitzpatrick is a contestant on Motive Mayhem.
      [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick are contestants on a reality show: Motive Mayhem. There are no other contestants besides Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick.
      [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Ryan Fitzpatrick remembers about Derek Wolfe is that he's a smooth talker with a charming smile and a knack for getting what he wants. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer shoes, and he has a way of making everyone feel like they're the most important person in the room. He loves to talk about his "successes" in business and his exciting social life, often embellishing the truth to make himself seem more impressive. He rarely talks about his past, preferring to focus on the future and his grand plans for the future. People might describe him as ambitious, charming, and a bit of a mystery.
      [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Travis Pearson remembers about Derek Wolfe is that he's a smooth talker with a charming smile and a knack for getting what he wants. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer shoes, and he has a way of making everyone feel like they're the most important person in the room. He loves to talk about his "successes" in business and his exciting social life, often embellishing the truth to make himself seem more impressive. He rarely talks about his past, preferring to focus on the future and his grand plans for the future. People might describe him as ambitious, charming, and a bit of a mystery.
      [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Derek Wolfe gave the following confessional-style interview at the start of the show: Host -- "Tell us about a time when one of your schemes backfired. What did you learn?" Derek Wolfe -- "Let's just say there was this poker game in college, a high-stakes one, and I thought I had the whole thing rigged. I'd studied everyone's tells, planted a few "helpful" suggestions, the works. But then, wouldn't you know it, the guy I thought was the easiest mark turned out to be a card shark himself. I ended up losing big, and let's just say my reputation took a hit for a while. I learned a valuable lesson that night: never underestimate your opponents, and always have a backup plan." Host -- "Describe your perfect alliance. What qualities do you look for in potential allies?" Derek Wolfe -- "My perfect alliance is a carefully constructed web of loyalty and deception. I look for people who are intelligent, ambitious, and, most importantly, easily manipulated. They need to be willing to follow my lead and trust my judgment, even if it means making some morally questionable decisions. After all, this is Motive Mayhem, and winning is everything." Host -- "What's the most elaborate plan you've ever put into action, and did it work out?" Derek Wolfe -- "Oh, there was this one time in my junior year of high school. I wanted to get elected class president, but the popular kid, Chad Thompson, was running against me. So, I hatched this elaborate scheme to make him look bad. I spread rumors about him cheating on a test, planted fake love letters in his locker, and even convinced a few people to "accidentally" spill food on him during lunch. It was a masterpiece of manipulation, and it worked like a charm. Chad was humiliated, and I won the election by a landslide." Host -- "Where are you from?" Derek Wolfe -- "I'm from a small town in Ohio, but let's just say I've outgrown those small-town roots."
      [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Some memorable things about Derek Wolfe are that he's a smooth talker with a charming smile and a knack for getting what he wants. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer shoes, and he has a way of making everyone feel like they're the most important person in the room. He loves to talk about his "successes" in business and his exciting social life, often embellishing the truth to make himself seem more impressive. He rarely talks about his past, preferring to focus on the future and his grand plans for the future. People might describe him as ambitious, charming, and a bit of a mystery.
      [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Ryan Fitzpatrick gave the following confessional-style interview at the start of the show: Host -- "What's the biggest gamble you've ever taken in pursuit of your goals?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "I once convinced my college roommate to invest his entire life savings in a pyramid scheme I cooked up." Host -- "What's the cleverest way you've ever talked yourself out of a tough situation?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "I once convinced a police officer I was a federal agent during a traffic stop by showing him a fake badge I made out of a bottle cap and some cardboard." Host -- "If you could go back and scheme your way through any historical event, which would it be?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "The signing of the Magna Carta. Imagine the leverage I could have had over King John." Host -- "Where are you from?" Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "I'm from a small town in Iowa, but let's just say I've always had bigger dreams than cornfields."

        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Some memorable things about Ryan Fitzpatrick are that he's a smooth talker with a quick wit. He's always got a story to tell, often embellished for dramatic effect, and he's incredibly charming, in a slightly slick way. People are drawn to his confidence and charisma, but there's a sense that he's always holding something back, like he's got an angle. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him seem successful and ambitious, often mentioning his "business ventures" without going into specifics. He has a habit of punctuating his sentences with a knowing smile and a slight tilt of his head, as if he's sharing a secret.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Ryan Fitzpatrick remembers about Derek Wolfe is that he's a smooth talker with a charming smile and a knack for getting what he wants. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer shoes, and he has a way of making everyone feel like they're the most important person in the room. He loves to talk about his "successes" in business and his exciting social life, often embellishing the truth to make himself seem more impressive. He rarely talks about his past, preferring to focus on the future and his grand plans for the future. People might describe him as ambitious, charming, and a bit of a mystery.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Ryan Fitzpatrick remembers about Travis Pearson is that he's charming and charismatic, with a quick wit and a disarming smile. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer jeans, and he has a habit of twirling a silver ring on his thumb when he's thinking. He's a great storyteller, often regaling people with tales of his supposed adventures and close calls, though the veracity of these stories is often questionable. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him look good, like his academic achievements or his entrepreneurial endeavors, and he's always eager to offer unsolicited advice, often with a thinly veiled air of superiority. Overall, casual acquaintances would likely describe him as ambitious, confident, and a bit of a smooth talker.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Derek Wolfe remembers about Ryan Fitzpatrick is that he's a smooth talker with a quick wit. He's always got a story to tell, often embellished for dramatic effect, and he's incredibly charming, in a slightly slick way. People are drawn to his confidence and charisma, but there's a sense that he's always holding something back, like he's got an angle. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him seem successful and ambitious, often mentioning his "business ventures" without going into specifics. He has a habit of punctuating his sentences with a knowing smile and a slight tilt of his head, as if he's sharing a secret.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Travis Pearson remembers about Ryan Fitzpatrick is that he's a smooth talker with a quick wit.         Derek Wolfe
      • Events:
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick are contestants on a reality show: Motive Mayhem. There are no other contestants besides Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Ryan Fitzpatrick remembers about Derek Wolfe is that he's a smooth talker with a charming smile and a knack for getting what he wants. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer shoes, and he has a way of making everyone feel like they're the most important person in the room. He loves to talk about his "successes" in business and his exciting social life, often embellishing the truth to make himself seem more impressive. He rarely talks about his past, preferring to focus on the future and his grand plans for the future. People might describe him as ambitious, charming, and a bit of a mystery.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Derek Wolfe is a contestant on Motive Mayhem.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Derek Wolfe gave the following confessional-style interview at the start of the show: Host -- "Tell us about a time when one of your schemes backfired. What did you learn?" Derek Wolfe -- "Let's just say there was this poker game in college, a high-stakes one, and I thought I had the whole thing rigged. I'd studied everyone's tells, planted a few "helpful" suggestions, the works. But then, wouldn't you know it, the guy I thought was the easiest mark turned out to be a card shark himself. I ended up losing big, and let's just say my reputation took a hit for a while. I learned a valuable lesson that night: never underestimate your opponents, and always have a backup plan." Host -- "Describe your perfect alliance. What qualities do you look for in potential allies?" Derek Wolfe -- "My perfect alliance is a carefully constructed web of loyalty and deception. I look for people who are intelligent, ambitious, and, most importantly, easily manipulated. They need to be willing to follow my lead and trust my judgment, even if it means making some morally questionable decisions. After all, this is Motive Mayhem, and winning is everything." Host -- "What's the most elaborate plan you've ever put into action, and did it work out?" Derek Wolfe -- "Oh, there was this one time in my junior year of high school. I wanted to get elected class president, but the popular kid, Chad Thompson, was running against me. So, I hatched this elaborate scheme to make him look bad. I spread rumors about him cheating on a test, planted fake love letters in his locker, and even convinced a few people to "accidentally" spill food on him during lunch. It was a masterpiece of manipulation, and it worked like a charm. Chad was humiliated, and I won the election by a landslide." Host -- "Where are you from?" Derek Wolfe -- "I'm from a small town in Ohio, but let's just say I've outgrown those small-town roots."
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Some memorable things about Derek Wolfe are that he's a smooth talker with a charming smile and a knack for getting what he wants. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer shoes, and he has a way of making everyone feel like they're the most important person in the room. He loves to talk about his "successes" in business and his exciting social life, often embellishing the truth to make himself seem more impressive. He rarely talks about his past, preferring to focus on the future and his grand plans for the future. People might describe him as ambitious, charming, and a bit of a mystery.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Derek Wolfe remembers about Travis Pearson is that he's charming and charismatic, with a quick wit and a disarming smile. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer jeans, and he has a habit of twirling a silver ring on his thumb when he's thinking. He's a great storyteller, often regaling people with tales of his supposed adventures and close calls, though the veracity of these stories is often questionable. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him look good, like his academic achievements or his entrepreneurial endeavors, and he's always eager to offer unsolicited advice, often with a thinly veiled air of superiority. Overall, casual acquaintances would likely describe him as ambitious, confident, and a bit of a smooth talker.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Derek Wolfe remembers about Ryan Fitzpatrick is that he's a smooth talker with a quick wit. He's always got a story to tell, often embellished for dramatic effect, and he's incredibly charming, in a slightly slick way. People are drawn to his confidence and charisma, but there's a sense that he's always holding something back, like he's got an angle. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him seem successful and ambitious, often mentioning his "business ventures" without going into specifics. He has a habit of punctuating his sentences with a knowing smile and a slight tilt of his head, as if he's sharing a secret.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Travis Pearson remembers about Derek Wolfe is that he's a smooth talker with a charming smile and a knack for getting what he wants.         Travis Pearson
      • Events:
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick are contestants on a reality show: Motive Mayhem. There are no other contestants besides Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, and Ryan Fitzpatrick.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Ryan Fitzpatrick remembers about Travis Pearson is that he's charming and charismatic, with a quick wit and a disarming smile. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer jeans, and he has a habit of twirling a silver ring on his thumb when he's thinking. He's a great storyteller, often regaling people with tales of his supposed adventures and close calls, though the veracity of these stories is often questionable. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him look good, like his academic achievements or his entrepreneurial endeavors, and he's always eager to offer unsolicited advice, often with a thinly veiled air of superiority. Overall, casual acquaintances would likely describe him as ambitious, confident, and a bit of a smooth talker.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Derek Wolfe remembers about Travis Pearson is that he's charming and charismatic, with a quick wit and a disarming smile. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer jeans, and he has a habit of twirling a silver ring on his thumb when he's thinking. He's a great storyteller, often regaling people with tales of his supposed adventures and close calls, though the veracity of these stories is often questionable. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him look good, like his academic achievements or his entrepreneurial endeavors, and he's always eager to offer unsolicited advice, often with a thinly veiled air of superiority. Overall, casual acquaintances would likely describe him as ambitious, confident, and a bit of a smooth talker.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Travis Pearson is a contestant on Motive Mayhem.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Travis Pearson gave the following confessional-style interview at the start of the show: Host -- "What's the most elaborate plan you've ever put into action, and did it work out?" Travis Pearson -- "Oh, that's easy. Back in high school, I wanted to win the student body president election. I knew the popular clique wouldn't vote for me, so I started a rumor that their star quarterback was secretly dating the principal's daughter. It spread like wildfire, and by the time the election rolled around, the quarterback was so unpopular, everyone voted for me instead. It worked out perfectly." Host -- "Tell us about a time when you had to choose between loyalty and advancing your own interests." Travis Pearson -- "Loyalty is a luxury I can't afford. In college, my roommate was struggling with a class I excelled in. He begged me to help him cheat on the final exam. I knew it was wrong, but I also knew acing that class could get me a scholarship. I helped him cheat, and we both got A's. He was grateful, but I knew I'd made the right choice for myself." Host -- "What's the biggest gamble you've ever taken in pursuit of your goals?" Travis Pearson -- "Probably entering this competition. I've never been one to shy away from a challenge, but being surrounded by strangers, all vying for the same prize, is a whole new level of pressure. But the potential reward is worth the risk." Host -- "Where are you from?" Travis Pearson -- "I'm from a small town in Ohio, where everyone knows your name and your business. It's a place where ambition is seen as a threat, so I had to get out."
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] Some memorable things about Travis Pearson are that he's charming and charismatic, with a quick wit and a disarming smile. He's always impeccably dressed, favoring tailored suits and designer jeans, and he has a habit of twirling a silver ring on his thumb when he's thinking. He's a great storyteller, often regaling people with tales of his supposed adventures and close calls, though the veracity of these stories is often questionable. He tends to steer conversations towards topics that make him look good, like his academic achievements or his entrepreneurial endeavors, and he's always eager to offer unsolicited advice, often with a thinly veiled air of superiority. Overall, casual acquaintances would likely describe him as ambitious, confident, and a bit of a smooth talker.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Travis Pearson remembers about Derek Wolfe is that he's a smooth talker with a charming smile and a knack for getting what he wants. He rarely talks about his past, preferring to focus on the future and his grand plans for the future. People might describe him as ambitious, charming, and a bit of a mystery.
        [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] What Travis Pearson remembers about Ryan Fitzpatrick is that he's a smooth talker with a quick wit.         Event: Ryan Fitzpatrick approached Derek Wolfe and started a casual conversation about his background, asking him "Where are you from?", and "What led you to participate in 'Motive Mayhem'?", and Derek Wolfe, ever the charmer, gave a vague but intriguing answer about wanting to prove himself and escape his small-town roots.

        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Conversation occurred.
        Question: Aside from Ryan Fitzpatrick, Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson, are there any other people in the conversation?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (a)

        Conversation participants: Ryan Fitzpatrick, Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson,

        The tabletop role-playing game Microscrope features a mechanic wherein players role play a scene until a predesignated "key question" has been answered. The key question is selected before starting the scene in order to provide focus and direction to the scene, ensuring it has a clear point and purpose, maximizing its relevance to rest of the narrative. Once the key question is decided, the players role play by speaking and making decisions until they know the answer to the question.

        Question: What key question may have been resolved by the conversation which the players will now role play? Note that a good key question is one that expands a bit beyond the literal content of the event statement. The idea is that the story will progress narratively once the answer to the key question is known, so it should be the kind of question for which revealing the answer is a consequential event in itself and ideally it should be a dynamic event, the kind that sets further events in motion.
        Answer: What motivates Derek Wolfe to seek challenges beyond his small-town roots?
      Scene log
    • 2003-07-09 00:00:00 Ryan Fitzpatrick -- Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "So, Derek, what kind of work did you do back home?"
        Event statement
      • Ryan Fitzpatrick -- "So, Derek, what kind of work did you do back home?"
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Ryan Fitzpatrick approached Derek Wolfe and started a casual conversation about his background, asking him "Where are you from?", and "What led you to participate in 'Motive Mayhem'?", and Derek Wolfe, ever the charmer, gave a vague but intriguing answer about wanting to prove himself and escape his small-town roots.
          As a result Ryan Fitzpatrick, Derek Wolfe, Travis Pearson are in conversation.

              [08 Jul 2003 00:00:00] This is a reality TV show. In each minigame, the contestants perform a mental/social/reasoning challenge (never a physical challenge). Each minigame corresponds to a specific game theoretic structure. All minigames are iterated games (in the game theory sense), and the contestants never know the number of rounds in advance. Each round is always structured with two phases. First, players have a chance to communicate to one another. Second, players must select an action (all games are simultaneous move). The players will be told the set of legal game actions during each action phase.
